Key Match Events: The Warriors won the middle quarters by 27 points, led by as many as 37 points, and cruised to a runaway 139-104 season-opening win.
Stephen Curry was one rebound shy of a triple-double and sat the entire fourth quarter.
Draymond Green played 20 minutes, had an excellent defensive stretch to open the second half, and then sat for the night.
Buddy Hield scored 22 points in only 15 minutes off the bench, making five of his seven 3s and hustling around for five rebounds.
Pre-Game Insights: Steve Kerr knew he had 12 players he felt could be in his rotation but figured 10 would be the max on opening night in Portland.
The Blazers are projected by most to finish last in the Western Conference.
Post-Match Reflections: Steve Kerr said he will keep the Warriors in a 12-man rotation moving forward.
Stephen Curry commented on the team's depth and versatility, stating that they can rely on their depth and ability to be versatile depending on what the game calls for.
Draymond Green indicated he would be fine after banging knees with Toumani Camara, but noted that bruises and absences pile up over an 82-game marathon.
Jonathan Kuminga expressed that he is not concerned about his contract extension and is focused on performing every day.
Stephen Curry praised Buddy Hield postgame, highlighting his love for basketball and great personality.
Stephen Curry mentioned the importance of having no agenda and no egos in the team, and noted that he hasn't seen any red flags of negative energy.
